title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
Response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.

Task A: Identify ONE way in which African states or societies changed as a result of the Cold War.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· The Cold War hastened decolonization as the United States often did not oppose it.

· Some newly independent states allied themselves with either the Western bloc or with the Communist bloc

· Some newly independent states tried to remain non-aligned or sought regional African alliances.

· Western or Soviet economic and military aid modernized African societies to some extent but also sometimes put in power or kept in power corrupt leaders/elites.

Task B: Explain how ONE specific African state was affected by the Cold War.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· Some African states, such as Ethiopia and Mozambique, became affiliated with the USSR and the Communist bloc.

· Some African states, such as Congo and Angola experienced Cold War proxy conflicts.

· Some African states, such as Egypt and Ghana, were active in the Non-Aligned Movement.

Task C: Explain ONE way in which events in Africa affected the broader context of the Cold War.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· Soviet spending on economic and military aid to African governments (or non-governmental resistance groups) contributed to weakening the Soviet economy.

· Western resistance to decolonization increased the appeal of communism as an alternative economic and political system, both in Africa, and more globally

· The corruption and weak economic performance of various Western and Soviet satellite states lessened the appeal of the Western or Soviet models respectively.
Response accomplishes any one of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes any two of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes all three of the tasks set by the question.
